oracles package¶

Submodules¶

oracles.cntnv module¶

Summary¶

Simulate a day’s worth of sales for a newsvendor.

class oracles.cntnv.CntNV(fixed_factors={})¶

Bases: base.Oracle

An oracle that simulates a day’s worth of sales for a newsvendor with a Burr Type XII demand distribution. Returns the profit, after accounting for order costs and salvage.

name¶

name of oracle

Type

string

n_rngs¶

number of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

Type

int

n_responses¶

number of responses (performance measures)

Type

int

factors¶

changeable factors of the simulation model

Type

dict

specifications¶

details of each factor (for GUI, data validation, and defaults)

Type

dict

switch case for checking factor simulatability

Type

dict

Parameters

check_simulatable_factors()¶

Determine if a simulation replication can be run with the given factors.

Returns

is_simulatable – indicates if oracle specified by factors is simulatable

Return type

bool

replicate(rng_list)¶

Simulate a single replication for the current oracle factors.

Parameters

rng_list (list of rng.MRG32k3a objects) – rngs for oracle to use when simulating a replication

Returns

responses – performance measures of interest “profit” = profit in this scenario “stockout_qty” = amount by which demand exceeded supply “stockout” = was there unmet demand? (Y/N)

Return type

dict

oracles.facilitysizing module¶

Summary¶

Simulate a facilitysize problem.

class oracles.facilitysizing.facilitysize(fixed_factors={})¶

Bases: base.Oracle

An oracle that simulates a facilitysize problem with a multi-variate normal distribution. Returns the probability of violating demand in each scenario. .. attribute:: n_rngs

number of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

type

int

list of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

is_simulatable – indicates if oracle specified by factors is simulatable

Return type

bool

replicate()¶

Simulate a single replication for the current oracle factors.

Returns

  • responses (dict) – performance measures of interest “stock_out_flag” = the binary variable

    0 : all facilities satisfy the demand 1 : one of the facilities did not satisfy the demand

    ”count” = the number of facilities which cannot satisfy the demand “number_of_cut” = the number of toal demand which cannot be satisfied

  • gradients (dict of dicts) – gradient estimates for each response

oracles.mm1queue module¶

Summary¶

Simulate a M/M/1 queue.

class oracles.mm1queue.MM1Queue(fixed_factors={})¶

Bases: base.Oracle

An oracle that simulates an M/M/1 queue with an Exponential(lambda) interarrival time distribution and an Exponential(x) service time distribution. Returns

  • the average sojourn time

  • the average waiting time

  • the fraction of customers who wait

for customers after a warmup period.

name¶

name of oracle

Type

string

n_rngs¶

number of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

Type

int

n_responses¶

Type

replicate(rng_list)¶

Simulate a single replication for the current oracle factors.

Parameters

rng_list (list of rng.MRG32k3a objects) – rngs for oracle to use when simulating a replication

Returns

  • responses (dict) – performance measures of interest “avg_sojourn_time” = average sojourn time “avg_waiting_time” = average waiting time “frac_cust_wait” = fraction of customers who wait

  • gradients (dict of dicts) – gradient estimates for each response

oracles.sscont module¶

Summary¶

Simulate multiple periods worth of sales for a (s,S) inventory problem with continuous inventory.

class oracles.sscont.SSCont(fixed_factors={})¶

Bases: base.Oracle

An oracle that simulates multiple periods worth of sales for a (s,S) inventory problem with continuous inventory, exponential demand distribution, and poisson lead time distribution. Returns the average cost per period after accounting for fixed and variable order costs, order rate, stockout rate, fraction of demand met with inventory on hand, average amount backordered given a stockout occured, and average amount ordered given an order occured.

n_rngs¶

number of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

Type

int

rng_list¶

list of random-number generators used to run a simulation replication

Type

list of rng.MRG32k3a objects

n_responses¶

number of responses (performance measures)

Type

int

factors¶

changeable factors of the simulation model

Type

dict

specifications¶

details of each factor (for GUI, data validation, and defaults)

Type

dict

switch case for checking factor simulatability

Type

base.Oracle

check_variable_cost()¶
check_warmup()¶
replicate()¶

Simulate a single replication for the current oracle factors.

Returns

responses – performance measures of interest “cost_mean” = average cost per period “on_time_rate” = fraction of demand met with stock on hand in store “order_rate” = fraction of periods an order was made “stockout_rate” = fraction of periods a stockout occured “avg_stockout” = mean amount of product backordered given a stockout occured “avg_order” = mean amount of product ordered given an order occured

Return type

dict
